results.title: Applying causal models to explore the mechanism of action of simvastatin in progressive multiple sclerosis
results.journal: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A
results.text_hl: A subsidiary aim was to investigate whether the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Microphthalmia_Syndromic_10</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C566985 @@@brain atrophy@@@ was targeting specific regions.

Applying causal models to explore the mechanism of action of simvastatin in progressive multiple sclerosis Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2019 May 28;116(22):11020-11027. PMID: 31072935

results.title: Effect of high-dose simvastatin on brain atrophy and disability in secondary progressive multiple sclerosis (MS-STAT): a randomised, placebo-controlled, phase 2 trial.
results.text_hl: INTERPRETATION: High-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduced the annualised rate of whole-@<m>DISEASE_Microphthalmia_Syndromic_10</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C566985 @@@brain atrophy@@@ compared with placebo, and was well tolerated and safe.

citations.NLM: Chataway J, Schuerer N, Alsanousi A, Chan D, MacManus D, Hunter K, Anderson V, Bangham CR, Clegg S, Nielsen C, Fox NC, Wilkie D, Nicholas JM, Calder VL, Greenwood J, Frost C, Nicholas R. Effect of high-dose simvastatin on brain atrophy and disability in secondary progressive multiple sclerosis (MS-STAT): a randomised, placebo-controlled, phase 2 trial. Lancet. 2014 Jun 28;383(9936):2213-21. PMID: 24655729

results.title: Effect of high-dose simvastatin on cognitive, neuropsychiatric, and health-related quality-of-life measures in secondary progressive multiple sclerosis: secondary analyses from the MS-STAT randomised, placebo-controlled trial
results.text_hl: In the 24-month MS-STAT phase 2 trial, we showed that high-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ significantly reduced the annualised rate of whole @<m>DISEASE_Microphthalmia_Syndromic_10</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C566985 @@@brain atrophy@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@secondary progressive multiple sclerosis@@@ (@DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@SPMS@@@).

citations.NLM: Chan D, Binks S, Nicholas JM, Frost C, Cardoso MJ, Ourselin S, Wilkie D, Nicholas R, Chataway J. Effect of high-dose simvastatin on cognitive, neuropsychiatric, and health-related quality-of-life measures in secondary progressive multiple sclerosis: secondary analyses from the MS-STAT randomised, placebo-controlled trial Lancet Neurol. 2017 Aug;16(8):591-600. results.title: Disease-Modifying Treatment in Progressive Multiple Sclerosis.
results.text_hl: Smaller early phase studies of @CHEMICAL_Thioctic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008063 @@@alpha-lipoic acid@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ each found slowing of rate of whole @<m>DISEASE_Microphthalmia_Syndromic_10</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C566985 @@@brain atrophy@@@ in @DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@SPMS@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.
